# Manage Automatic Renewals

In the Marketplace Platform, we automatically renew subscriptions for your convenience and to prevent any service interruptions.&#x20;

If you don't want your subscription to renew automatically, you can disable auto-renewal. By doing so, your subscription will expire at the end of the commitment period or renewal date, and you will not be billed after that.&#x20;

In cases where you previously disabled auto renewal for a subscription but want to re-enable it, you can do so before the subscription expires.

Disabling or enabling automatic renewal can be done by placing a configuration order.

## Disabling or enabling automatic renewal <a href="#h_01jey7dr4j22wpq7tv0kkq1yv3" id="h_01jey7dr4j22wpq7tv0kkq1yv3"></a>

To disable or enable automatic renewal:

1. Navigate to the **Subscriptions** page. Then, select the relevant subscription.
2. On the subscription details page, select the down arrow <img src="data:image/png;base64," alt="" data-size="line">and select **Configure** to start the configuration order wizard.&#x20;
3. On the **Auto renewal** page, choose **Enable** or **Disable** depending on the current renewal status and select **Next**.
4. On the **Order details** page, provide a reference ID for the configuration order and enter order notes as necessary. Then, select **Next**.
5. Review the details. When done, select **Place order**.&#x20;

The configuration order is placed, and the order summary is displayed. Select **View order** to go to the order details page. Otherwise, select **Close**.

Note that after the configuration order is placed, your agreement's status changes from **Active** to **Updating**. Once the order has been completed, the agreement's status changes back to **Active**, and the new auto-renewal status is reflected on the subscription's details page.
